titleInfo.title: Organically Grown in Vermont Conference Materials

mods.tableOfContents: Organic Food Matters: The Journal of Sustainable Agriculture, vol. II, no. 2, Summer 1989
Letter dated August 30, 1989: Jon Corcoran to Kathleen Merrigan. Enclosure: Transcript of conference comments
Up on the northern fringe, growers are going organic. Photocopy of article reprint from The Boston Globe, June 4, 1989
State of Vermont Executive Department: A Proclamation. National Organically Grown Week, August 11-20, 1989
Pamphlets: The Natural Organic Farmers Association of Vermont, Certified Organic: What it means to you
Luncheon Menu: Organically Grown in Vermont
Guest List: Organically Grown in Vermont
Regenerating America's Agriculture. Photocopy of article from Building Economic Alternatives, Summer 1989
mods.abstract: Consists of one folder containing materials presumably distributed at the Organically Grown in Vermont Conference, August 19, 1989. Materials include an agenda, attendee list and luncheon menu from the event; various promotional pamphlets; a periodical; photocopies of articles and quotes pertaining to organic agriculture; and a photocopy of the proclamation signed by Madeleine M. Kunin, Governor of Vermont, designating National Organically Grown Week in 1989. Also enclosed is a follow-up letter from the conference organizer to Kathleen Merrigan thanking her for speaking at the event.
mods.note: The folder containing the conference materials has hand-written annotations on the front and back covers.
mods.accessCondition: Please contact Special Collections for reproduction information.
The collection is open for research.

location.physicalLocation: National Agricultural Library, Special Collections (Beltsville, MD)
